page.title: 05FOREST OF DEAN DRIFT MINE
page.content:
{ { COAL HAS BEEN MINED IN THE FOREST OF DEAN SINCE PRE-ROMAN TIMES. UNTIL THE 19TH CENTURY ALL MINES WERE SHALLOW OR DRIFT MINES. THE LAST NATIONAL COAL BOARD DEEP MINE CLOSED IN 1965 BUT INDIVIDUALLY OWNED DRIFT MINES ARE STILL WORKED BY FREEMINERS.
TO BE A FREEMINER YOU HAVE TO LIVE WITHIN THE 'HUNDRED OF ST BRIAVELS'. ALSO YOU HAVE GOT TO WORK AT THE COAL FACE FOR A YEAR AND A DAY & OBTAIN PERMISSION.
AT CANNOP MINE 14 MEN ARE EMPLOYED. THE MINE SHAFT SLOPES STEEPLY DOWN INTO THE HILLSIDE. 3 MEN ARE DOWN THE MINE AT ONE TIME. THE MINERS USE EXPLOSIVES TO BREAK UP THE COAL DOWN INSIDE THE MINE. CONT. PAGE 6...
